name: Maple Cornmeal Cookies
recipeYield: about 3 dozen cookies, or a bunch more small ones

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oven to 375°F. Cream together the butter and the sugar; add the maple syrup, vanilla and egg and beat until well blended.
Combine the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt in a bowl. Add the dry ingredients in about 3 portions, and beat to make a soft dough that can be dropped from a spoon.

Drop tablespoon-sized mounds of dough about 3 inches apart in rows and columns on ungreased baking sheets. Bake until the edges are browned, about 10 minutes. Cool for about 2 minutes before using a spatula to transfer the cookies to a rack to finish cooling. Enjoy.
